messageBody:
Thanks, David, for the tip on customized main method... Customized based
on each method is what I'm looking for... In fact, I have already
re-written the main method to handle a different RunListener, but I
would be happy to hear about other solutions, since I have an xml files
with what arguments to read for each test in the test program and I
would rather reading the option whether to run it at the same place to
save parsing the file twice.



A side question: since I have a customized RunListener to write
pass/fail information to a log file, is there a way for me to pass this
info back into a textarea in my JFrame of my UI Java test program also?
(ie, how to convert a textare into a PrintStream to pass back to the
RunListener).



Thanks in advance,



Vietchau

Vietchau,

There are a couple of options. First, you can run individual methods
like this:

public static void main(String... args) {
new JUnitCore().run(Request.method(MyClass.class,
"selectedMethodName"));
}

or, if you want more fine-grained control, you can use a Filter:

public static void main(String... args) {
new JUnitCore().run(Request.aClass(MyClass.class).filterWith(new
MyFilter()));
}

I take from your post that you'll want to process the args passed in
to figure out the methods that should or shouldn't be run. Let me
know if writing your own main application meets your requirements--if
not, there are other options involving custom runners. Thanks,

David Saff
